archimate:Device.name: Base Radio Station (BRS)
archimate:Device.documentation:
Intended Use:
Serves as the central communication point for coordinating hospital operations, security, facilities, and emergency response. Base radios complement handheld radios by offering stronger signal coverage, hands-free operation, and longer duty cycles.
Frequency & Compatibility:
• Frequency Band: UHF (Ultra High Frequency): 400–470 MHz Must be compatible with handheld radios in use at St. Jude Hospital Support for licensed channels if using regulated hospital frequencies
• Channel Capacity: Minimum 128 programmable channels Privacy codes (CTCSS/DCS) support for secure communication Ability to assign department-specific channels (e.g., Security, Maintenance, Emergency)
• Modulation Type: FM analog Digital mode (DMR Tier II) for enhanced clarity and encryption
Transmission & Reception:
• RF Output Power: 25–50 watts adjustable High enough for strong in-building and multi-building coverage • Receiver Sensitivity: ≤ 0.25 µV for clear reception even in dense infrastructure • Antenna Type: External high-gain UHF base station antenna Includes coaxial cable (minimum 15–20 meters) and surge protector Pole or wall-mounted antenna for optimal elevation
Connectivity & Interfaces:
• Mic Options: Desk microphone (push-to-talk) Foot pedal or VOX hands-free mic • Audio Output: External speaker output Minimum 4–5W internal speaker with PA support • Accessory Ports: RJ-45 or accessory port for dispatch consoles, PC logging, or intercom systems • Remote Mounting Kit (): Allows separation of control head and radio body for flexible installations (e.g., wall mount with desktop controls)
Power Supply:
• Input Power: 13.8V DC ±15%, powered via external AC power supply Includes 100–240V AC power adapter, hospital-grade battery backup unit or UPS support for emergency operation Duty Cycle: Rated for continuous 24/7 operation (100% duty cycle)
Enclosure & Durability:
• Chassis: Rugged metal housing Fanless design or low-noise cooling • Mounting: Desktop or rack-mountable form factor Wall bracket kit • Operating Environment: Temperature: -10°C to +50°C Humidity: 10–90% non-condensing
Display & Controls:
• Display: Alphanumeric LCD with channel and status display Backlit for low-light use • Controls: Channel selector, volume knob, programmable function buttons Password-protected menu
Security & Logging:
• Call Logging: PC connection for real-time recording/logging of transmissions • Emergency Features: Emergency alarm relay to alert during distress signals from handheld radios
Accessories & Add-Ons:
• High-gain outdoor UHF antenna kit (with surge protection) • External PA speaker system • Foot switch or VOX headset for dispatchers • Battery backup unit / UPS • Logging software or PC interface
